# Si9n SDK Feeds

The Si9n SDK includes an object that allows you to easily integrated Feed based content.  It includes automatic fetching when feed data changes and local caching.

```javascript
    import si9n, {Feed} from 'si9n-sdk' // or si9n.Feed if using the minified bundle

    // only available after the ready event
    si9n.on('ready', () => {
        // gets an array of all feeds available to the device
        const list = Feed.list()

        // get the default feed (first one found)
        const feed = Feed.use()

        // or a specific feed
        const feed = Feed.use('FEEDID')

        // watch the feed for updates
        const watcher = feed.watch()
        watcher.on('items', items => {
            // array of items, is called every time the items change
            console.log(items)
        })

        // alternatively, get a list of items
        feed.items().then(data => console.log(data))

        // events
        feed.on('change', () => console.log('the feed has changed'))

        // clean up
        feed.destroy()
        watcher.destroy()

        // can override the built in device auth settings (i.e. whilst testing)
        const feed = Feed.use({
            id: 'xxxxxxxxxxx', // feed uuid
            host: 'dev-api.si9n.io', // can point to a different server
            auth: {
                type: '', // place or device
                org: '',  // org id
                id: '',   // place or device id
                key: ''   // place or device secret
            }
        })
    })
```
